title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with HR first, then had department interview arranged and offer was made within a reasonable time period. In comparison to other NP interview processes, this was much more efficient.
Interview Questions: Discussion surrounding a challenging encounter and how I navigated this.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a few interviews starting with HR and ending with the team. They were relatively straightforward and standard. Not to challenging or out of the ordinary. I heard back from HR in a quick timeframe with my offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to solve a difficult problem.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: it was fine. manager wasnt the nicest and disagreed with my opinions and put me down. It felt like she already had her answer before i started the interview. I felt very underprepared after i left.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: easy interview, kind interview team, and recruiter. Each step was communicated by the recruiter and when I met with the team everyone was friendly and timely. I appreciated how each member explained their position and their significance to the team.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation where you felt it didn't align with your values?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Shame to not even be called for an interview as a former employee who left in good standing with the organization. Explored external options due to what is said on similar posts about difficulty to move up and pay. After achieving so many accolades to not even get a call to discuss is disappointing.
Interview Questions: Did you ever work for LGH

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: You'll start with sitting down in a nice area in the hospital that is quiet. 1-2 people will interview you who belong o the area you'll be in (mostly). They'll ask you a packet of questions ranging from your strengths to your experience in tough situations and situations that you may come across on the job.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Hired Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from a recruiter. Went through a phone screen. After that I met with my manager and another RN. They asked me questions about my values and work experience.
Interview Questions: What does being inclusive mean to you?

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: You will first be contacted by HR for a phone interview to go over your resume and be asked behavioral/situation questions. From there if you get called in for an in person interview with the hiring manager you do get asked a generic packet of questions which are a lot of questions but for the most part is more questions that at situation based, what your current manager would say about you, have you ever not been able to make a patient content, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here/ why do you want this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Great, answered quickly and nice to work with, just a far commute for me. Would interview there again, just too far of a commute. Not bad, definitely a good hospital
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: First step was a phone screen with HR first.  Followed up by a department interview with department leads.  Last step was a panel interview with the team in the interviewing department.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you've had to deal with a difficult patient?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview journey started off with the HR person getting confused about a date. I brushed it off, we all have off days. Then, on the day I was scheduled for a phone interview, I got all ready and prepared... and, sat around for 15 minutes before I went on with my day. No call, nothing. I had to email them to ask what's going on. Apparently, the HR person didn't put it on her calendar. I decided to let this slide as well. Surely this HR person cannot be representative of the entire company, right? Finally, I got to speak with them. Mind you, she called 6 minutes early, and my thought is that she wanted to get the interview over with so she could leave for the day. But anyhow, the interview was less thorough than my first job at a burger place. Very cookie cutter questions. No follow up questions. No conversation. I was just a name to check off their list. It really rocked my world when I was asked if I have work experience. I thought to myself, do you even know who you're talking to?? My guess is they just want a body to fill the position. I then withdrew my interest. As I work through my biology Masters, I will never look to this place as a potential employer again.
Interview Questions: Basic and cookie-cutter. Nothing that required thought.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview was relaxed and lasted about 30 minutes. Was given details of in-person interview over the phone. Went in for interview with the unit manager a week later. Lasted around 4 hrs.  45 min interview with around 20-25 questions. 90% behavioral, 10% clinical scenarios. Was fairly difficult even if you come well-prepared. Then you are given a unit tour and shadow for 2-3hrs. Received an offer one week later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a lot on your plate.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Very informative interview process with detailed processes of the job explained. Also, was given a chance to speak with persons already performing the position. and to meet others in the department and see where the desk is located.
Interview Questions: Years of customer service experience.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then an unperson interview with shadowing opportunity afterwards. Standard interview questions and one situational clinical question. Nice staff, a little disorganized but pleasant experience overall. Interview and shadowing lasted three hours.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Lancaster?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: questions were tough but thorough. Staff were very friendly during interview process. LGH requires phone screen prior to in person interviews. Some recruiters allow applications to sit for weeks to months before reaching to to applicant.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you were pushed to the max and how did you handle it.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Screening phone interview with the Human Resources department. Scheduled interview with clinic director where was interviewed, met staff, and toured facility. Employees were kind, welcoming, and personable during whole process.
Interview Questions: Name a situation that you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Patient Care Host Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen asking general questions and were more interested in whether you had prior customer service experience. Recruiter went over my resume and asked me basic questions about it to determine if I was a fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Call Center Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Application, then assessment, then phone interview, once passed that portion resume gets forwarded to department manager and they reach out if interested in bringing you in for in person interview.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions - Tell me about a difficult time with a customer you had to work through? Tell me about why you would be a good fit for this role

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call about an interview few days after with HR.  Phone interview with HR, then interview with department managers about two days after that. Regular interview questions.
Interview Questions: When did you deal with a crisis

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and thorough. Personable. HR was very kind and put me at ease right off the bat. In person interview was challenging. Behavioral questions were very loaded. Questions were asked about my employment history, why I am leaving my current job, my future plans for education, and why I believe I'm the best fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a part of our office and what  qualities would you bring?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: We sat down 1:1 and discussed multiple questions regarding the job and how things go in a hospital. We went over the patients population. Also where my training would take place and how that works
Interview Questions: How do I deal with difficult situations

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Answered questions about past employers, and was introduced to staff.  went through  all the steps and it was looking promising to getting the job. Received an email 4 days later saying it’s been filled.
Interview Questions: Do you belive teamwork is important?

title: Storeroom Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone Call. Asked if I smoked, answer occasional cigar. Said does not meet their guidelines. Question for Lancaster General. Do you ask how much do you over eat or eat unhealthy. I have been to their facilities and 75% of their employees are over weight, does the unhealthy eating habits keep them from getting hired? Discrimination at the highest level, I hope someone starts a class action against this discriminating company. I will be the first to join in. It is ok to clog your arteries with fat and unhealthy eating but no smoking a cigar a few times a week. Disgusting over reach on their part. Are you making sure everyone working for you is or isn't getting an abortion? Are you making sure everyone working for you is eating low fat salads instead of your café or McDonalds.  DISCRIMINATION! Please everyone do not put an application in to this Liberal discriminating Company.
Interview Questions: Do You Smoke?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied via website. Had to complete personality assessment after initial application. Went in for interview on unit. Met with manager, charge nurse, and unit clerk. Round robin of different questions asking about previous experience, scenarios, work ethic ect. Gave me time to ask my own questions. Then finished by shadowing on unit.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a mistake you made and what did you do to make it better.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions: Took a few weeks after applying to be "invited to complete an online assessment".  Basically,  gauging how well you get along with others, how honest you are, nothing extreme.  After taking the assessment I received an auto reply that stated I am not qualified and I won't be considered for another position for 6 months.  I have never experienced anything like this...ever!   It seems the Human Resources department is relying heavily on an outdated personality test instead of actually speaking with potential human assets.
Interview Questions: The assessment asked basic personality questions such as "I prefer to work by myself", do you strongly agree, agree, somewhat agree, somewhat disagree, disagree, strongly disagree.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online in March 2017. I was in contact with a member of HR. I felt that I had established a solid rapport with that individual and was highly encouraged to apply. 

After applying, I was sent a link to follow and complete an online assessment. This assessment was looking at soft skills, personality traits, how you handle situations, your priorities and where you hope you're career will go. I felt confident completing the assessment and was hopeful to hear back from HR.

It took them three weeks to respond after I sent several e-mails. The response I got back was generic and impersonal. I was told I had failed the assessment and could not be qualified for any RN positions for the next six months. I was devastated and discouraged. I thought that a lot of the assessment questions could have been perceived and understood in various ways. It is hard to say that an assessment about someone's personality is black and white or right and wrong. I would have liked to have someone speak to me or interview me face to face. It astounds me that an organization as great as LGH would base a possible employee off of a computer screen and not by how they present the act in person. This exact situation also happened to two of my classmates. Individuals that are compassionate, caring, intelligent and strong. LGH lost a employees who was hoping to establish a life-long career at their hospital and be a part of the growing transformation of its health care industry.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Web Mobile Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Pre-screening interview was an online self assessment. It was a generic survey of soft skills, career aspirations, work ethics, etc., career priorities, etc. 

I was immediately disqualified with no explanation. At no point was I in contact with a human, nor given the opportunity to explain whatever answers disqualified me. 

I honestly don't know what they were looking for.  I tend to "over think" these types of questions (it's actually a trait has helped me succeed in my career), and frequently found I could interpret the phrasing in two different ways, which would  entirely change the meaning of the answers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: After my application was submitted I was sent a behavioral screening. You must pass the screening in order to qualify for a phone interview. This time line was about 4 days. After passing the screening you have a phone interview and after this your information is presented to the hiring manager. The hiring manager will decide if they want to bring you in for an interview. I had about a 3 day elapsed timeline from phone screen to interview. I had 1 in person interview with the manager and director together. I received the offer that evening. I started approximately 10 days after this.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Lancaster General Health

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very structured and organized. Excellent selection of executives participated. Interview questions were prepared in advance and each of them were thoughtful and meaningful.  Overall, left with an excellent impression of the organization.
Interview Questions: Previous experience in role

title: Office Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA)
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview with a recruiting agent. Lasted about thirty to forty five minutes. Set up second interview to meet the staff at the office. Very kind. Took about thirty minutes for interview followed by tour of office. Took a week to hear back about job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? And a few scenario questions.  There was a packet of listed questions they followed.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 2 nurse managers. Lasted about 25 minutes. Started by describing the job and benefits then read from a packet of questions. After they asked if I had any questions and then it was over. Felt very rushed and scripted. Was never asked questions such as "about me, strengths or weaknesses." Felt very impersonal.
Interview Questions:
What is one word that my previous employer would use to describe me?
Why did you choose LGH?
Tell me a time when you had a complicated client, coworker, or supervisor and how did you handle it?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: She asked a few questions and spent a hour talking about herself and hospital stories. It was not as professional as I thought it was. She talked more than I did. It was a relaxed interview however. Wasn't bad at all.
Interview Questions: Would I be able to handle repetitive work

title: Medical Billing Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. 2 supervisors and the billing manager. It went well and i got the position on my first interview. The wanted me to elaborate on my experience in billing, ICD9 coding and administrative duties.
Interview Questions: what company system did we use.. ( PBMS- similar system to medisoft) My last employment.. The reason I left UPS and also to explain how to handle irrate patients.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Because I was already an employee, I scheduled the interview directly with the manager and didn't have to go through HR. HR always seems to be turning over, and is not very efficient.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a bedside nurse who keeps calling me when I am busy admitting people in the ER?

title: Document Image Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The inteterview process took 2 weeks. After emplyee referal HR  arrange telephone first Interwiew. They ask me general questions, most from my resume, after this HR put me for second round, with HR again, after that in the same day I had 3 Interwiew with manager. They ask me behewiar Q.
Interview Questions: How  do you prioritize your work?

title: Bill Specialist/Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and fast process,  I got to do a group interview, I was questioned on my skills and background as a medical biller.. I am sure i got the job as soon as I left the interview. The next day they called to tell me that i start on monday... (The interview was on a Thursday)
Interview Questions: What do I do when I have an irrate patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly lengthy. First you interview with HR. Once you complete the HR interview you interview with the floor nurse manager. The Interview in the nurse managers office was very informal which seemed to confusing. The interview consisted of many scenario questions. This was a difficult interview.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions are a large portion of these interviews.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR phone screen, in person interview with leaders, coworkers, and team members. The a 2nd interview with Executive leaders. It was a good process that gave a very transparent overview of the organization and the role.
Interview Questions: Why LGH?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview by recruiter and then to the department supervisor. For the initial department interview, a panel of current employers were present and asked questions. Questions asked were very relevant, good exchange of information and response to my questions as well.
Interview Questions: List your strengths and weaknesses. Pasts experience, expound on resume.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with a recruiter who went over your resume and information. They then matched you with an employment listing that fit your goals. Then meet with the manager and do a walk around and interview. Usually after one or two days you would receive a call with a yes or no and begin the background check and clearance process.
Interview Questions: How does working with LGhealth fit into your future health care goals?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and interview in Lancaster. Entire process took about a Month. Had a preliminary interview with HR, then had an interview with IT several team members.  Asked questions predominately about my experience and interests. Very nice group of people and were very welcoming given that I was only a freshman in college.
Interview Questions: They asked me how I would solve a business problem using excel and asked me to go through specific steps.

title: Psychiatric Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: You apply and receive a call to schedule an interview. Be prepared for a behavioral interview. Basically, you will be asked about your past behaviors in a series of situations and you need to answer using the STAR method. I found that to be a bit ridiculous considering the low profile job that I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time when you failed.

title: Medical Records Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: First met with an HR recruiting who then directed me to the Manager of MRS in which I did my real interview. After that, I needed to complete and drug test.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Health Records Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lancaster General Health (Lancaster, PA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Manager called to schedule interview. Took a skills test and had interview, then went home. Over a week later was called with a job offer, then came in to take a drug test and other paperwork. I started the job 2 weeks later with an orientation that took 3 days, then the actual job began.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?
